description:
Launch event for Belgian stakeholders of the Girls Code Europe campaign.

Draft Agenda:

19:00-19:30 - Introduction to the Girls Code Europe Team, Campaign, Platform & Upcoming Events, by Cheryl Miller/DLI
19:30-20:00 - Introduction of Attendees and Sollicitation of Campaign Partners
20:00-21:00 - Discussion & Networking

While you're eagerly looking forward to the event, please feel free to like our Facebook Page and follow @GirlsCodeEU on Twitter!

Registration via Eventbrite: http://bit.ly/gsce1
name: Girls Code Europe - Belgium Platform Launch

description:
The Digital Leadership Institute and its partners are proud to announce launch of the Girls Code Europe campaign, taking the form of three linked events during Europe Code Week 2014.*  The Girls Code Europe Intro to Open Data is an evening workshop taking place on 13 October to prepare girls, mentors and volunteers for the two subsequent GCE events of Europe Code Week.  Please visit the links for information on all the events.

• 13 October:  Girls Code Europe Open Data Event

• 15 October: Girls Code Europe Launch Event

• 17-18 October: Girls Code Europe at transforma bxl Open Data Hackathon with the City of Brussels

Draft Agenda for Girls Code Europe Intro to Open Data:

• 18:00-18:30:  Intro of GCE Campaign & Europe Code Week Events by DLI

• 18:30-19:30:  Overview of City of Brussels Open Data with transforma bxl & City of Brussels

• 19:30-21:00:  Open Data Web & App Exercises and Brainstorming for Girls Code Europe Launch Event

*Attendance at all three events is not required, but if you wish to attend all three events, you must register for each event at the noted links.

The present event is open to beginner girl coders, experienced programmers and other individuals and organisations keen to get more girls and women coding!

Questions?  Please don't hesitate to contact us.  And while you're eagerly looking forward to the event, please feel free to like our Facebook Page and follow @GirlsCodeEU on Twitter!

Registration via Eventbrite:  http://bit.ly/GCEPrep
name: Girls Code Europe - Intro to Open Data

description:
The Digital Leadership Institute and its partners are proud to announce launch of the Girls Code Europe campaign with this special event of the 2014 Europe Code Week including VIP keynotes, lightening talks from outstanding European women in tech, and a coding & app development workshop for girls of all ages. 

14:00-15:00:  Coding Workshop Kick-off
15:00-16:30: Keynote Speech & Lightening Talks - Open to Public, Limited Seating:

• Ms. Saskia Van Uffelen/CEO Ericsson Belux & Belgian Digital Champion

• Ms. Mercedes Diaz/Accenture & Young Adviser to Neelie Kroes

• Ms. Wendy Vermoesen/RealDolmen & ICT Young Lady of the Year 2014

• Ms. Lune Van Ewijk - European 2013 Digital Girl of the Year

And others to be announced!


16:30-17:00: Refreshment Pause
17:00-19:30: Coding Workshop 
19:30-20:00:  Workshop Wrap-up, Closing & Nibbles


While you're eagerly looking forward to the event, please feel free to like our Facebook Page and follow @GirlsCodeEU on Twitter!

Registration via Eventbrite:  http://bit.ly/GCELaunch
name: Girls Code Europe - Launch Event & Coding Workshop

description:
We would like to enter 20 girls & women in 2-3 multidisciplinary teams in the transforma bxl Open Data Hackathon with the City of Brussels on 17-18 October!

If you're interested in taking part, please also consider joining us for the preparatory events, where girls and women of all skill levels are welcome and encouraged to attend:

• 13 October (transforma bxl):  Intro to Open Data evening with experts from the City of Brussels.  Eventbrite registration:  http://bit.ly/GCEPrep

• 15 October (Co.Station):  Girls Code Europe Launch & Coding Workshop on App Development with VIP & lightening talks from outstanding women in tech.  Eventbrite registration:  http://bit.ly/GCELaunch 

• 17-18 October (transforma bxl):  Girls Code Europe at transforma bxl Open Data hackathon with the City of Brussels.  Registration:  http://bit.ly/transformaOpenData

The higher your coding skills or experience level, the larger a role you can play in formulating and executing any/all of these events, including coaching and boot-strapping less-experienced girls and women, and encouraging them to code!  For each event, we are looking for girls and women of all backgrounds and profiles, and in order to attend, you need to register for each event individually.  If you require a scholarship for the Hackathon, please also let us know this.

If you'd like to learn more about the GCE initiative, please join us for the Girls Code Europe Belgium Stakeholder Launch event taking place on 8 September, at:  http://bit.ly/gces1 

Or contact Cheryl at girlscodeeu(at)dlii(dot)org

Doesn't this sound like a great opportunity?  Please sign up if you'd like to be involved as a participant, coach and/or in any other kind of volunteer role.  We're looking forward to hearing from you!
name: Girls Code Europe at transforma bxl Open Data Hackathon
